page.title: 12Local history of Insch.
page.content: A little west of Insch you will find Dunnydeer _ a hill of history. Dunnydeer has the remains of three forts on it.One,though in ruins is still seen as a castle.Although the turf fort is unrecognisable we can still see the remains of a Vitrified Fort.In this type of fort the stones would have been piled up and wood set around them and then set alight.This produced such a heat that the stones melted into one another. North of Dunnydeer is the Picardy Stone,dated from the 9th century.It has some strange carvings such as Z_rods,a snake,double discs and a mirror on it.It is not clearly known what these symbols mean. The name Insch has a history too__ in 1536 it was known as Inchis and in 1550 Inche.This is from Innis meaning meadow or haugh.
